questions.question: Which of the following data elements are key to an effective Software Asset Management practice within ServiceNow? (Choose four.)

comments.content: ABCE. Page 69 study guide.

Important data to track in SAM:
-	Entitlements: license metrics, purchased rights, active rights, allocations available
-	Allocations: user, device
-	Software model: publisher, product, suite information, entitlements, End of Life
-	Foundation data: users, departments, cost centers, locations, vendors
Sam Pro Fundamentals course, Trustworthy Data overview, Data tracking
ABCE. Page 69 study guide.
Yep. ABCE. Trustworthy data section of the Now Learning course for SAM Pro Fundamentals.
This is correct based on the Lesson in Now learning
ABCE is the correct answer.
Should be ABDE
replies: Wrong. ABCE. Contracts are NOT included.

questions.question:
HOTSPOT -
Match the best practice method for the amount of data:

comments.content: The answer given is correct: SAM Professional Fundamentals course, Trustworthy Data,  Import Software Data Using System Import Sets, Using System Import Sets

questions.most_voted: Large amount of data – Discovery;  Medium amount of data – Import data; Small amount of data – Manual

questions.question: Within Software Asset Management there are many key terms to understand, what is the best definition for Normalization?
answers: A. One or more use rights assigned to a specific device or user
B. Classification of the acquired software
C. The process of standardizing discovered software installation to defined norms
D. The process of producing a compliance position by comparing the number of software rights acquired against the normalized software inventory
E. Software license details that define use rights

comments.content: SAM Professional Fundamentals course, Trustworthy Data, Discovery Model Normalization, Why Software Normalization

questions.question: Which discovery sources are recommended by ServiceNow to populate ServiceNow software installation table? (Choose two.)

comments.content: C, D are the Right answer
C, D are right

SAM Professional Fundamentals course, Trustworthy Data, Software Discovery, What is Software Discovery: One of the most efficient ways to populate software asset information is by using automated discovery tools such as ServiceNow® Discovery (for data center software) and Microsoft SCCM (for desktop software), although other discovery tools can also be used.

Software Discovery module under Trustworthy Data portion of SAM Pro Fundamentals:

'One of the most efficient ways to populate software asset information is by using automated discovery tools such as ServiceNow® Discovery (for data center software) and Microsoft SCCM (for desktop software), although other discovery tools can also be used.'
C, D are the right options
CD are the right answer

questions.question: Creation of a template can help facilitate future data imports and be reused to import and transform data.

comments.content: A (TRUE) is the right answer
It is surely A
A (TRUE)

SAM Professional Fundamentals course, Trustworthy Data, Importing Software Data Using System Import Sets, Import Data: Create Or Update?: Create a template 

You can take steps to facilitate future data imports if you plan to import regularly. One of the easiest methods is to set up a spreadsheet or comma-separated value (CSV) template for the data you wish to import. Define the columns in the table view to export and set a filter to export a smaller subset of data. Because the data structure is the same for every import, you can reuse the import set table and transform it. Furthermore, your System Administrator can set up a scheduled import to occur regularly.
ServiceNow has a template that you can use, but it does not look like creating your own (or altering their version) is recommended.
replies: Misread this in the documentation. Agree with A (True).

questions.question: Client access is the right to use for a specific amount of time.

comments.content: B is the right answer

B- In Software Asset Management, client access generally refers to the right for a client (such as a user or device) to access and use specific software. It does not inherently imply a specific time limit; rather, it is usually tied to the terms of the software license, which could be perpetual, subscription-based, or otherwise defined by the license agreement. The right to use for a specific amount of time would typically be described as a subscription or term license, not client acces
Software subscription: rights to use software for a specific amount of time. Who’s using a subscription software and the last time there was activity.

SAM Professional Fundamentals course, Practical Management, Practical Management Overview, Common Terms: Client Access is a software license measured by the number of users or devices that can access a product.
B is correct
B, Subscription is the definition

questions.question: Coalesce can only use a single field to uniquely identify a record.

comments.content: Coalesce can be applied on multiple fields

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/tokyo-platform-administration/page/administer/import-sets/concept/c_ImportSetCoalesce.html

Multiple-field coalesce
You can coalesce on multiple fields to update an existing record.

If a target table record exists with the same values in all coalesce fields as the staging table record, the target table record is updated using the staging table record values. All coalesce field values between the target and staging tables must match to coalesce with multiple fields.
How is it possible to have so many wrong answers flagged as correct.

There is a question later talking about coalescing on multiple fields.

Most of the answers on this study guide are WRONG. Make sure you read the discussions, where documentation is normally provided.

questions.question: When receiving an order, which data point is mandatory?

comments.content:
Receive purchase orders: When receiving software entitlements, the asset tag, serial number, and license keys can be updated directly from the receiving popup.

Asset Tag is a required field. If the organization does not have asset tag software, consider having the purchasing product automatically generate a unique asset tag number.
Right answer is C, based on servicenow SAM Fundamentals Course on operation integration module

questions.question: How are the Software Asset Management Professional Plugins activated?
answers: A. They are requested from and activated by an admin user
B. They are activated by the sam_developer user
C. They are activated by the sam_admin user
D. They are requested from and activated by ServiceNow support
E. They are activated by default in the base ServiceNow system

comments.content:
SAM Professional requires a separate subscription and must be activated by ServiceNow personnel. 

quote for quote from the fundamentals training

A&D
Servicenow SAM Kurs Lab:
"Software Asset Management related plugins vary in how they can be verified. Plugins that can be activated by the ServiceNow administrator can easily be verified as they display as Active in the plugins list. Plugins activated by ServiceNow need to be verified through alternate steps."

From SAM Product Overview (SAM Plugins) module in SAM Fundamentals:

To utilize SAM these plugins are available for activation:

Activate all Software Asset Management Professional plugins including Software Asset Workspace*
Software Asset Management Professional for Microsoft*
Software Asset Management Professional for Oracle*
Software Asset Management Professional for VMware*
Software Asset Management Professional for IBM*
Software Asset Management Professional for Citrix*
Software Asset Management Professional for Adobe*
Software Asset Management Professional for SAP*
Service Graph Connector for Microsoft SCCM*
Normalization Data Services Client
Normalization Data Services Configuration
Performance Analytics for Software Asset Management 

All plugins identified above must be activated by ServiceNow.

if you look at the latest documenation for Vancouver, It says:
To purchase a subscription or load demo data after activation, contact your ServiceNow account manager. Within a few days, the account manager can activate the plugin and load any demo data on the production and non-production instances of your organization.
If you do not have an account manager, decide to delay activation until after your purchase, or want to evaluate the product on a non-production instance at no extra charge, you can use this procedure to submit a plugin activation request through the ServiceNow® Now Support Service Portal. 
Therefore D
Activate all Software Asset Management Professional plugins including Software Asset Workspace - Role Required: Admin. This is from servicenow docs. A is the right answer.
This is the official "SAM Professional requires a separate subscription and must be activated by ServiceNow personnel."

SAM Plugins 
Plugins are software components that provide specific features and functionalities. Plugins may be enabled in one of the following ways: 
1.	Activated by default in the base ServiceNow system. 
2.	Activated by an admin user (not by default) through the ServiceNow Plugin list. 
3.	Requested from ServiceNow (for plugins with additional licensing requirements). 

so the correct answer is A, E

In the course it literally says: "All plugins identified above must be activated by ServiceNow".
This is in Utah
The plugin must be activate in the STORE by an admin, so the answer D is incorrect.
view on course
replies: In the course said the plugin can be activate in the Servicenow STORE, and not support...
Where did you find that exactly?

questions.question: Which of the following are true of plugins? (Choose two.)
answers: A. Plugins can be disabled or deactivated when no longer in use.
B. Plugins can be activated by default in the base ServiceNow system.
C. When a plugin is active you cannot hide its functionality.
D. Plugins are stand-alone and do not depend on other plugins being activated.
E. Plugins are software components that provide specific features and functionalities.

comments.content:
Plugins are software components that provide specific features and functionalities. Plugins may be enabled in one of the following ways:

Activated by default in the base ServiceNow system.
Activated by an admin user (not by default) through the ServiceNow Plugin list.
Requested from ServiceNow (for plugins with additional licensing requirements).
B and E correct, from SAM Fundamentals > SAM Product Overview
B and E are actually correct.  (From page 29 in the text from the course)
A and E are the Right answers
replies:
A is definitely wrong. 

From the text: 'After a plugin is active, it cannot be disabled or deactivated. The functionality, however, may be hidden.'

questions.question: When receiving software related to a purchase order in ServiceNow, which data point is mandatory?

comments.content: E. Asset Tag is the correct answer.   (the proof is on page 348 of the text book included in the SAM pro course)
Right answer is E, based on servicenow SAM Fundamentals Course on operation integration module

Receive purchase orders: When receiving software entitlements, the asset tag, serial number, and license keys can be updated directly from the receiving popup.

Asset Tag is a required field. If the organization does not have asset tag software, consider having the purchasing product automatically generate a unique asset tag number.

Receive purchase orders: When receiving software entitlements, the asset tag, serial number, and license keys can be updated directly from the receiving popup.

Asset Tag is a required field. If the organization does not have asset tag software, consider having the purchasing product automatically generate a unique asset tag number.
Asset Tag is mandatory

Receive purchase orders:
i.	When receiving software entitlements, the asset tag, serial number, and license keys can be updated directly from the receiving popup.
ii.	Asset Tag is a required field. If the organization does not have asset tag software, consider having the purchasing product automatically generate a unique asset tag number.
iii.	When items are received, an entitlement will be automatically created with the number of active rights identified as received. The rights will then need to be allocated.
D. ( License Key) is the right answer

questions.question: Which of the following are NOT features of the Publisher workbench navigation tree? (Choose two.)

The navigation tree features are:

Software model compliance icons

The navigation tree features are:

Compliance toggle switch

questions.question: What is used to determine if installations are a part of a suite only when the suite parent is not discovered on a device?

comments.content:
SAM Professional Fundamentals On Demand Course, Practical Management, Practical Management Overview, Software Suites:
Suites can identify inference criteria. An inference percent defines what percent of the suite must be installed to be recognized as a suite. This is only used if the suite parent does not exist on the device.

"d.	Suites can identify inference criteria. 
i.	An inference percent defines what percent of the suite must be installed to be recognized as a suite. 
ii.	This is only used if the suite parent does not exist on the device.
"
Explanation: https://www.servicenow.com/community/sam-blog/handling-software-suites-on-servicenow-sam/ba-p/2284642

questions.question: Which statements are true in regards to ServiceNow’s Client Software Distribution (CSD) functionality? (Choose two.)
answers: A. Removes software daily utilizing a scheduled job.
B. ServiceNow does not have Client Software Distribution.
C. The first stage in the CSD process flow is configuration.
D. CSD can automatically distribute and reclaim software without a license for Orchestration.

comments.content: can't be D, as there is separate subscription needed for distribution (orchestration)

Does anyone have any proof that A is correct? When scanning the documentation (https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-servicenow-platform/page/product/orchestration/concept/c_SCCMSoftwareRevocation.html)  it suggests that removal is handled via Workflow Activities, not some form of scheduled job. 

I'm leaning towards D, as no Orchestration license is required for CSD if SAM is already installed. I'm making an assumption that it is installed as part of this question as this is what the exam is on.
Okay I want to give a new answer because D is not true, Orchestration plugin is needed for reclamation.

It's AC:
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-servicenow-platform/page/product/orchestration/concept/c_ClientSoftwareDistribution.html
replies:
Request client software distribution

Client software distribution requires the Orchestration - Client Software Distribution plugin (com.snc.orchestration.client_sf_distribution), which is available by request with a subscription to Orchestration.

comments.content:
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-servicenow-platform/page/product/orchestration/concept/c_ClientSoftwareDistribution.html

The Client Software Distribution (CSD) application allows administrators to distribute software from the service catalog using third-party management systems.

CSD allows an administrator to create all the records necessary to deploy software from service catalog requests, including software models and catalog items. You can use the CSD application to automate the deployment and revocation of software from an SCCM host using the custom SCCM activity pack. You can define lease periods for software distributed from the Service Catalog and allow lease extensions in some cases, pending approvals. Deployment is accomplished using Orchestration activities and workflows.

There is also a picture there that shows Configuration as the first step.

The diagram shows "Configuration" as stage 1 = C. 
" You can use the CSD application to automate the deployment and revocation of software from an SCCM host using the custom SCCM activity pack." = D

Sources: CSD - https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/rome-servicenow-platform/page/product/orchestration/concept/c_ClientSoftwareDistribution.html

SCCM Activity Pack outlining the Orchestration functions without the need for a separate license: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/rome-servicenow-platform/page/administer/orchestration-activities/concept/c_SCCMActivityPack.html

The full CSD product allows administrators to distribute, manage, and revoke software/ reclaim license automation, only revocation/reclamation capability is entitled as part of SAM. Full use of CSD product requires the Orchestration - Clien Software Distribution.
Which means you cannot distribute without Orchestration license as its said in asnwer D.

While SAM relies on Orchestration to perform software reclamation, the actual functionality is included in the SAM Professional license (i.e., the revocation/reclamation capability is entitled as part of SAM Pro). You do not need to own/purchase Orchestration separately in order to revoke software/reclaim license rights using SAM Pro.
replies: This is where I have a problem with the question when looking at the other comments. Surely if the course/exam is centered around SAM, then there is no requirement to purchase a license for Orchestration as you will already have it as part of SAM. This is why I was leaning towards D being correct.

comments.content: D is not correct, I believe correct answer is A & C

questions.question: Within the Capability Blueprint there are 4 tiers identified. Which tier is identified as Tier 1?

comments.content:
Answer: C. Trustworthy Data
Explanation:
    Tier 1. Trustworthy Data – Ensuring reliable, accurate, and structured data for effective decision-making.
    Tier 2. Practical Management – Implementing efficient processes to manage software assets effectively
    Tier 3. Operational Integration – Aligning software asset management with broader IT operations.
    Tier 4. Strategic Conformance – Ensuring compliance and alignment with business objectives.
Source: Course Material
Trustworthy data

questions.question: Which of the following features aggregates usage over a period of time and specifies a minimum number of hours the software must be used, or date last used?

comments.content: Actually - E. Software reclamation rule is correct  Verified rom page 393 AND 421 in the text included in the ServiceNow SAM Pro course

e.	Reclamation: reclamation rules are used to aggregate usage records and identify unused or underutilized software to be flagged for reclamation. They can be configured for:
	Minimum number of hours used 
	Specific time periods
	Notifications to the user and a response
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/concept/sw-reclamation-rules.html

* Ans: E (Stepherbun is correct)
SW Reclamation Rule (Answer E) - it defines the time duration that must be unused (or used) - page 422 in eBook of the SN SAM Pro course
SW usage (Answer A) is only for providing the metering info, not to define (as Must use), so not the correct answer here
A. Software Usage Metering is the right answer

questions.question: By default, which user role must verify the successful activation of plugins by ServiceNow support?

comments.content:
there is no role called sys_admin.
C (sam_admin) is the right answer

An answer being wrong does not mean an alternative is necessarily right. The answer is 'admin' as others have suggested. 'sam_admin' does not have privileges to review plugin installations directly. 

There are no right answers here but the equivalent to admin, 'sys_admin' is the one the person who submitted these questions had intended to be the correct answer

It's D.
From the Course Lab: As a ServiceNow administrator, I need to validate that all required Software Asset Management functionality... 1. Log in as the System Administrator...
sys_adminというロールはありません。ただし、プラグインのインストール結果を確認するのはシステム管理者の責任であり、それにはadminロールが必要です。私はadminの代わりにsys_adminを選択します。
replies: English: There is no role named sys_admin. However, it is the responsibility of the system administrator to check the results of the plugin installation, which requires the admin role. I choose sys_admin instead of admin.

comments.content:
I would also say sys_admin because of this in the course:
By default, the ServiceNow administrator persona (admin role) is responsible for loading asset management data from integrations and discovery tools into SAM Pro.

This is said specifically out of context to the sam_admin role.

for sure not sys_admin (does not exist). System Administrator [admin] is the correct role. Even though this is in SAM exam, it is one of the general questions. I would still pick this option in the actual test (they have lot of mistakes in them btw)
If there is no "sys_admin", the only right answer is sam_admin...

questions.question: When populating software usage records automatically via Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM), which plugins are required? (Choose two.)
answers: B. Microsoft SCCM Software Usage plugin
D. Performance Analytics Premium for Software Asset Management plugin

comments.content:
Definitely BC

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/task/configure-sccm-sam.html

Microsoft SCCM Integration plugins: integrate Microsoft SCCM with SAM
Microsoft SCCM Software Usage plugins: import software usage data from Microsoft SCCM to SAM. Both SCCM plugins can be installed through System Definitions --> Plugins.
Explanation in Servicenow Documentation: https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/utah-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/concept/sccm-software-usage.html

Activate the SCCM integration plugin for your version of SCCM.
Integration — Microsoft SCCM 2012 v2 (com.snc.integration.sccm2012v2)
Integration — Microsoft SCCM 2016 (com.snc.integration.sccm2016)
If you want to pull software usage data from SCCM, activate the software usage plugin for your version of SCCM.

Integration — Microsoft SCCM 2012 v2 Software Usage (com.snc.samp_usage_sccm) plugin
Integration — Microsoft SCCM 2016 Software Usage (com.snc.samp.usage_sccm_2016) plugin
B & C are the correct option, I read it in the booklet provided by servicenow
A & B are the right answer

questions.question: An allocation is automatically created in which of the following scenarios? (Choose two.)
answers: A. After receiving the rights for software from a purchase order
B. After a Create allocation remediation option has been taken
C. After reconciliation runs and identifies that rights are ‘Not allocated in use’
D. When a software installation is discovered

in the fundamentals training,

1. Source from existing available rights or create a purchase order to source from a vendor. 

		There are two options are available when sourcing a request:

Add allocation

2. Software entitlement rights may be allocated through the software request process (service catalog), the software remediation process (based on reconciliation)

From the course:
Allocations identify a user or device with one or more rights to use a software entitlement. Each entitlement will have multiple allocations, and each user or device can have multiple rights allocated to them.

From forum https://www.servicenow.com/community/sam-forum/sam-pro-auto-allocation-of-software-entitlement-from-software/m-p/1338136

Following the import if the software entitlement records, run a reconciliation and in the Remediation Options for the software models in question, you can select Create allocations and automatically allocate the available entitlement rights.
as gicali wrote

B and C:

for B:
https://support.servicenow.com/kb?id=kb_article_view&sysparm_article=KB0728369#:~:text=When%20allocations%20are%20created%20via,the%20allocation%20condition%20is%20met.

Cannot find for C
can anyone confirm if it's B and C? I can't find this anywhere
B and C are the right answers

questions.question: Which of the following are required to import usage data using the System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM) data? (Choose three.)

comments.content: "reclamation rule" is not necessary to import data

A software product must have a product process, which consists of a filename, that is required for SCCM Usage to pull data. When adding a software product to a reclamation rule, any product processes associated with the software product are shown in the Product Process related list. Product processes are stored in the Software Product Process [samp_sw_product_process] table.

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/utah-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/task/create-reclamation-rule-sccm.html

"A software product must have a product process, which consists of a filename, that is required for SCCM Usage to pull data. When adding a software product to a reclamation rule, any product processes associated with the software product are shown in the Product Process related list. Product processes are stored in the Software Product Process [samp_sw_product_process] table."

"A software product must have a product process, which consists of a filename, that is required for SCCM Usage to pull data. When adding a software product to a reclamation rule, any product processes associated with the software product are shown in the Product Process related list. Product processes are stored in the Software Product Process [samp_sw_product_process] table."

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/utah-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/task/create-reclamation-rule-sccm.html

questions.question: If a value from an import does not exist in ServiceNow and the import should not create a new record, which option should be selected?

comments.content:
The right answer is A: Reject to not create a record, if "ignore" is selected, the record will still me created.

create: Create a new choice or record in the reference table.
ignore: Ignore the new value from the source table.
reject: Skip the entire row (record) containing the new value and continue to the next row.

The question is not clear about what record should not be created as in this scenario the transform would be creating two records, not one. 

There are two possibilities:
- If the transforms target record should not be created, then Reject is the correct answer as this will stop the creation of the new choice or reference data and also block the insert of the target record
- If the target choice or reference records should not be created, then Ignore would be a more appropriate option. This would allow the insert of the target record but block the insert of the new choice/reference data and leave the associated field on the target record empty. Reject would also work here but that would be throwing the baby out with the bath water.

Delete is not a valid choice and Create is the happy path where you want to insert the related record

A. Reject will skip the record. 
Ignore will create a record, but leave the field empty or filled with default value.

Correct Answer D
Ignore, ignores the value
Reject, rejects the whole row
it should be ignore

questions.question: What is a first key step prior to uploading your entitlement import data via the ServiceNow-provided template?
answers: A. Ensure you have filled out every field in the template file
B. Ensure the entitlement data is listed on the first tab of the template file
C. Ensure you have downloaded and used the latest version of the template file
D. Ensure you have the sam_user role assigned to you

comments.content: As best practice, download the import template each time you import as there may be changes from release to release
Explanation in SAM Fundamentals
Correct answer is C. The first tab contains the instructions for how to fill out the template.

questions.question: What are three ways to get software asset data into ServiceNow?

comments.content: trust me bro. i have a CTA

questions.question: The Software Asset Management Content Service is automatically enabled and cannot be opted out.

comments.content: Content Data Services: provides continual software recognition improvement based on your Discovery data. By default, you are opted out, you only receive normalization service updates from other sources. When opted in, you can exclude specific software Discovery models from being provided to ServiceNow by checking the ‘Exclude from content service’ check box on the Discovery model form.

questions.question: What table is populated with the content library data that is pulled from the content service?

comments.content: After the content download is complete, the updated content is pulled into the staging columns of the Software Publishers (samp_sw_publisher), Software Products (samp_sw_product), Discovery maps (samp_sw_entitlement_definition), and Software Product Definitions (samp_sw_product_definition) tables. A query runs and identifies what transactional data in your instance must be updated with the new content. After the changes are identified, the changes are then propagated to your instance

If the ServiceNow instance is SN hosted, a weekly job runs to automatically pull normalization library content data from the content server. Determining whether the content has been pulled:
-	Query Download Schedules (cds_client_schedule) for each table starting with “samp_”. The Last Updated On column will contain when the data for that table was last pulled from the content server.
-	In the content that ships with the plugin, there are over 7,700 records in samp_sw_package table.
The content service tables starts with samp_sw

questions.question: When specified during an entitlement import, which of the following is matched to data in the Content Service Library and used to create a software model automatically?

comments.content:
From the course:
The Publisher Part Number is optional, yet recommended. If available, the import process will automate matching this Software Entitlement with the correct Software Model, creating it if it doesn’t already exist. If you do not have this field, the next four fields are mandatory (publisher, product, version, and edition). Since the solution must match every Software Entitlement with a Software Model, if the publisher part number were not present, the next four fields combined would identify the Software Model in lieu of automating it via publisher part number.

questions.question: As part of the software normalization process, software discovery models are normalized via which mechanisms? (Choose two.)

comments.content:
Discovery models are compared to ServiceNow's Software Content Library
As part of the software normalization process, software discovery models are normalized:
	• Business Rule Create a Software Normalization executes before insert/update and normalizes (Publisher, Product, and Version ) discovery model using the exact match rules (samp_package_map, samp_product_map, cds_client_name). Pattern based rules are not run during execution of the business rule.
	• Scheduled job Discovery Model Normalization (sysauto_script) runs daily.
		○ Processes all discovery models that are not normalized or manually normalized.
			§ First attempts to normalize based on the exact match rules (package, product, publisher).
			§ Then applies the pattern based rules in batch across the remaining discovery models.

8.	Normalization of software discovery models:
a.	Business Rule Create a Software Normalization executes before insert/update and normalizes discovery model using the exact match rules (samp_package_map, samp_product_map, cds_client_name). Pattern based rules are not run during execution of the business rule
b.	Scheduled job Discovery Model Normalization (sysauto_script) runs daily.
i.	Processes all discovery models that are not normalized or manually normalized.
1.	First attempts to normalize based on the exact match rules (package, product, publisher).
2.	Then applies the pattern based rules in batch across the remaining discovery models.

Discovery models are compared to ServiceNow’s Software Content Library:
-	Business rule ‘Create a Software Normalization’ executes and normalizes discovery model using the exact match rules. 
-	Scheduled job ‘Discovery Model Normalization (sysauto_script) runs daily.
o	Processes all Discovery models that are not normalized or manually normalized.
o	First attempts on exact match rules (package, product, publisher), then applies pattern based rules.
I Agree with fmineo - the correct answer is B & C - that excerpt is from page 132 of the text for the SN SAM Pro course.

questions.question: What is the definition of Partially Normalized?
answers: A. A discovery model normalized based on publisher field alone.
B. The software discovery model has not yet completed its run through the normalization process.
C. A discovery model was normalized based on publisher and product fields only.
D. A discovery model was normalized based on publisher, product, version fields.

comments.content:
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/reference/normalization-status.html

A discovery model is partially normalized based on publisher and product fields only. In this case, the version field is editable and once that information is added the normalization status is changed to Manually Normalized.

questions.question: What is the name of the Scheduled job that runs daily for normalization?

comments.content: https://www.servicenow.com/docs/bundle/vancouver-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/concept/ml-learning-sam.html

Discovery models are compared to ServiceNow’s Software Content Library:
-	Business rule ‘Create a Software Normalization’ executes and normalizes discovery model using the exact match rules. 
-	Scheduled job ‘Discovery Model Normalization (sysauto_script) runs daily.
o	Processes all Discovery models that are not normalized or manually normalized.
o	First attempts on exact match rules (package, product, publisher), then applies pattern based rules.

Seems to have changed, but D is closest:
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/concept/ml-learning-sam.html

The scheduled job, SAM-Normalize discovery models using content library rules, triggers on a daily basis and normalizes the discovery models based on the content rules.
Answer is A
Scheduled job Discovery Model Normalization (sysauto_script) runs daily.

questions.question: Within Software Asset Management there are many key terms to understand, what is the best definition for Software Allocation?
answers: A. One or more use rights assigned to a specific device or user.
B. Something acquired with use rights.
C. The process of normalizing a discovered software installation to standardized values.
D. Finding and recognizing software or a software feature on a device.

comments.content: Software allocations in ServiceNow’s Software Asset Management Professional product are records that grant one or many right(s), are identified on the entitlement record, and assigned to a user or device to use the software.
I agree - It's answer A - the definition is on page 8 of the ServiceNow SAM pro text that came with the course.

Software allocation: records that grant one or many rights, are identified on the entitlement record and assigned to a user or device to use the software. Entitlements that have available rights may be allocated to multiple users or devices, so each entitlement will have multiple allocations.

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-it-service-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/task/t_AddAnEntitlementAllocationSAMF.html

A user or device allocation can be added to a software entitlement to specify a user or device to which rights have been allocated.
Question is about Software Allocation.
I agree it should be "A"
A is the definition of allocation

Answer is the definition of allocation 

A
It's answer A -

A is what serviceNow has mentioned
right definition

questions.question: How often is the scheduled job for the normalization process run?
answers: C. Every time Discovery is run
D. Nightly for new discovery models and weekly for all discovery models that do not have a status of normalized or manually normalized
E. Immediately for new discovery models and nightly for all discovery models that do not have a status of normalized or manually normalized

comments.content: Scheduled job Discovery Model Normalization (sysauto_script) runs daily.

While A seems correct, I think E is the most correct. "A scheduled job for the normalization process runs daily. Whenever a new discovery model is created, the normalization process is run and the status is indicated."
replies: Hmmmmmm, actually it's still [A] because what is happening "...whenever a new discovery model is created" is not a scheduled job but a business rule.

comments.content: -	Scheduled job ‘Discovery Model Normalization (sysauto_script) runs daily.
It's answer A -
Runs daily

questions.question: Discovery models may not be fully normalized until updated content is downloaded from the ServiceNow Software Content Library. How do you determine if the content has been downloaded?
answers: A. Review the Last updated date of the Central Data Service Download Status jobs on the Normalization and Content Service dashboard.
B. Determine if the business rule “Create a Software Normalization Download” has been triggered yet or not.
C. Query the scheduled job reports to determine if the “Software Content Library Download” (samp_cds_download) job has completed yet.
D. Review the number of records in the samp_product_map table. If there are ~7,700 records in the table, the download has completed at least once.

comments.content:
Correct answer is A according to the documentation

The Central Data Service Download Status related list is updated daily when the SAM — Central Data Service Download Status job is run.

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/tokyo-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/concept/sam-normalization-dash.html

A seems the most logical one

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/concept/sam-normalization-dash.html
I agree, the Answer should be A - it is also on page 132 of the SN SamPro text that came with the course.

questions.question: When populating the Downgrade Rights table, if there is no software model corresponding to a discovery map, which of the following is automatically created?

comments.content:
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/concept/downgrade-rights.html

If there is no software model corresponding to a discovery map, when populating the Downgrade Rights [samp_sw_downgrade_model] table, a new software model is automatically created.

questions.question: For software asset management, when software is discovered, the records from the discovered pattern are copied into which table?

comments.content:
From the course:
If a matching record is found in the Software Discovery Model table [cmdb_sam_sw_install], then the Software Installation table updates the software discovery model record. If a record is not found, a new record is created. Data is then passed to the Software [cmdb_ci_spkg] table to preserve backward compatibility.
cmbd_sam_sw_install should be cmdb_sam_sw_install
replies: Agreed! I noticed that each answer has "CMBD" as the prefix...could throw people off because "D." is the only correct Prefix, but that table does not exist.

questions.question: Within ServiceNow Discovery, the Exploration phase determines what?
answers: A. Are you there? How will I classify you?
B. What else can you tell me about yourself?
C. Have I seen you before?
D. How should I classify you specifically?

comments.content: Option B is correct answer
Exploration: “What else can you tell me about yourself?”

Four Discovery phases:
-	Scanning: Are you there? How will I classify you?
o	Probes and sensors are used
-	Classification: How should I classify you specifically?
o	Probes and sensors are used
-	Identification: Have I seen you before?
o	Patterns are used (or additional probes and sensors)
-	Exploration: What else can you tell me about yourself? 
o	Software running on the IP-enabled device is identified
o	Patterns are used (or additional probes and sensors)

a.	Scanning: “Are you there? How will I classify you?”
b.	Classification: “How should I classify you specifically?”
c.	Identification: “Have I seen you before?”:
i.	Patterns are used
d.	Exploration: “What else can you tell me about yourself?”
i.	Patterns are used
I agree - the answer is B as per page 113 from the SN SAM Pro text provided with the course.
exploration add specific information about Serce

C. Run the “Discover software installations” script to copy records from the [cmdb_ci_spkg] table to the [cmdb_sam_sw_install] table
D. Export the records from the [cmdb_ci_spkg] table into an xml spreadsheet and import them into the [cmdb_sam_sw_install] table

Migrate software installations
If you are using Discovery, run this script after installing the Software Asset Management application to copy previously discovered software installation records from the [cmdb_software_instance] table to the [cmdb_sam_sw_install] table, which is used by the Software Asset Management application to store software installation records.

-	Scanning: Are you there? How will I classify you?
o	Probes and sensors are used
-	Classification: How should I classify you specifically?
o	Probes and sensors are used
-	Identification: Have I seen you before?
o	Patterns are used (or additional probes and sensors)
-	Exploration: What else can you tell me about yourself? 
o	Software running on the IP-enabled device is identified
o	Patterns are used (or additional probes and sensors)
Exploration is the phase where the software running on the IP-enabled device is identified.

questions.question: When are discovery models created?
answers: B. They are automatically created during discovery
C. When SAM Plugin is enabled
D. They are automatically created during reconciliation
E. They are automatically created during normalization.

comments.content: Software Discovery model: automatically created during discovery or import process to identify and normalize the software installed in an environment.

From Software Discovery in SAM Fundamentals:

As part of the discovery process, software installations are matched with a software discovery model using the primary key from the Software Installation [cmdb_sam_sw_install] table. If a software discovery model is not found that matches the primary key, a new software discovery model is automatically created.

questions.question: By default, which persona is responsible for controlling the day-to-day activities of the SAM process and ensuring the overall quality of software asset data?

comments.content:
Personas:
-	SAM Process Owner: a senior manager with the influence and authority to ensure that the SAM process is rolled out and executed correctly and consistently across the organization.
-	SAM Manager: a manager responsible for control of the day-to-day activities of the SAM process, ensuring the quality of software asset data.
-	SAM Administrator: responsible for creating and maintaining software asset information, including software models, software entitlements and allocations defined within the scope of their area.
-	ServiceNow Administrator: responsible for loading of asset management data, integrations and discovery tools into SAM Pro.

From SAM Product Overview in SAM Fundamentals:

SAM Manager: A manager responsible for control of the day-to-day activities of the SAM process, ensuring the quality of software asset data.

questions.question: When creating custom products: (Choose the best answer.)
answers: A. Custom products should not be tracked in ServiceNow.
B. Custom products should not be created for anything included in the content library.
C. Custom products are automatically created in the content library.
D. Custom products should be created for anything included in the content library.

comments.content:
If a software product does not exist in the Software Library, you can add a custom product. Custom products enable you to normalize and account for homegrown software, or software that is not yet part of the Software Library.
https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/tokyo-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/task/t_AddACustomProduct.html

Software product: used in combination with the publisher during Discovery model normalization. You can add a custom product if a software product does not exist in the Software library in Software Asset  Administration  Custom Products. Pay-for-license software products are stored in the Software Product table [sam_sw_product] which is updated from the ServiceNow Content Library.

If a software product does not exist in the Software Library, you can add a custom product. Custom products enable you to normalize and account for homegrown software, or software that is not yet part of the Software Library.
